poem:
Title: "Aiding Sunflowers in Winter"

Devised in the chills of conflict, lumens of aid,
Hungary's heart unlocks, a budgetary cascade.
Crossing the longitude of decisions, steered by Orbán's whisper,
Towards Ukrainian plains, a monetary drifter.
A €50bn shroud, for wounds and caves,
Yet caveat's specter over the selfless waves. 
Echoes the cresting divide, a timid refrain,
'Are we aiders or anchors, in this geopolitical game?'
